content.description: This is a two-three move problem. Likely a good quick warm-up before getting on anything else. Start with a right hand around the arete on a good jug, left hand on a sloper and smear both feet. Press off both feet to hit the bigger jug over the bulge and pull up and over.
content.location: left of the clean slab wall. it is an independent arete that we usually use to get down off of the boulder. its suggested to jump down onto a pad from the top of this problem.

content.description:
Start at the bottom middle of the clean slab side wall. Use a decent right foot (smeared) and pinching some crystals with each hand. Progress upward and right towards the top-out prow. Mantel over the prow to finish. 

  To get down either down climb "Left side arete" or jump down from the top of "Left side arete".

Start on the right arete of the clean slab side. Layback off the arete and smear both feet. Work your way up to the prow for the same mantel finish as "Get Lost Slab".

 To get down either down climb "Left side arete" or jump down from the top of "Left side arete".
content.location: right side arete, of the clean slab side

content.description: Start matching on the blunt arÃªte. Move straight up on some good holds to a decent topout.
content.location: Opposite side from get lost problems. Small hemlock tree almost in the way but not quite.

content.description:
Definitely a bit contrived. The crux of this route is getting established on the start. Start with a good big left side pull, right hand also on a decent jug. Press away from the corner with a good left foot and go for the right hand sloper. Move right foot up, after it is established, go for the next bump up with another right handed sloper. Find your balance and hit a good left hand hold. Lay-back moves to finish the tricky upper part and then its about 5-10 feet of easy slab to the very top!

 Get down by down climbing "Left side Arete" or jumping down from the top of "Left Side Arete", onto a pad!
content.protection: There is a big boulder right below the start that should be covered with a couple pads. Spotter is nice too.
content.location: On one of the corners of the boulder. Basically, the opposite corner of the "Get Lost Arete" problem.

content.description: Perched up off the main railroad track trail is this big boulder with a handful of problems on it. Granite. Gritty. Large crystals.
